preferences.name: preferredProtocol
preferences.title: Preferred Protocol
preferences.description: The VPN protocol this extension will use by default.

preferences.name: defaultConnectStrategy
preferences.title: Default Connect Strategy
preferences.description: How to choose an IVPN server in quick-connect commands (Connect, Toggle, and Quick Toggle).

preferences.name: flagIconSource
preferences.title: Flag Icon Source
preferences.description: Where flag icons are retrieved from.

commands.name: check-concise
commands.title: Peek Status
commands.description: Checks if IVPN is currently connected.

commands.name: check-verbose
commands.title: View Status Details
commands.description: Displays detailed information about your current IVPN connection status.

commands.name: toggle-concise
commands.title: Quick Toggle
commands.description: Toggles connection status and shows a concise, unintrusive toast message.

commands.name: toggle-verbose
commands.title: Toggle
commands.description: Toggles connection status and shows a detailed info window.

commands.name: servers-list
commands.title: Browse Servers
commands.description: Lets you pick from a list of servers to connect to.

preferences.name: connectDisconnectBehavior
preferences.title: Connect/Disconnect Behavior
preferences.description: Desired UI behavior when connecting & disconnecting.

commands.name: quick-connect-random
commands.title: Connect to Random Server
commands.description: Connects to a random IVPN server.

commands.name: quick-connect-fastest
commands.title: Connect to Fastest Server
commands.description: Connects to the fastest IVPN server.

commands.name: account-info
commands.title: View Account Details
commands.description: Shows information about the currently authenticated IVPN account.

commands.name: login
commands.title: Log in
commands.description: Logs you into your IVPN account given an account ID.

commands.name: logout
commands.title: Log out
commands.description: Logs you out of your IVPN account.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
